definitions: To rise to an upright position on one's feet.
To fail to keep an appointment with someone, especially a date.
To be valid or hold true under scrutiny.
To defend oneself or a principle.
examples: Please stand up when the judge enters.
He stood up his date again.
Her alibi didn't stand up in court.
You need to stand up for what you believe.
This material will stand up to heavy use.
